abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) in
            Romania. The main objectives of the project were: (i) to
            support stabilization efforts, while maintaining the
            momentum of price liberalization and the progressive opening
            of the economy; and (ii) to further structural reforms and
            to expand private ownership.  Bank's performance was
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was satisfactory.
            The key lessons learned were as follows: (i) political
            commitment and the early assumption of ownership by the
            implementing Government has been key to success; (ii) the
            change in government necessitated a substantial investment
            by the Bank in consultation and supervision; (iii) the SAL
            was ambitious, comprehensive and complex; (iv) the central
            importance of early macroeconomic stabilization emerges as a
            key lessonof the SAL; (v) the SAL supported privatization
            and achieved its specific agreements in this regard; (v)
            allowing large loss making-enterprisest o go bankrupt has
            proven extremely difficult; and (vi) institution building in
            all functions and endeavors of the market economy was a key
            objective of the SAL.
